Patient has gastrointestinal distress, which can be caused by a variety of factors, including food poisoning, viral infection, and bacterial infection.
Patient has gastrointestinal distress and has recently consumed new or unusual foods, which could be a sign of food poisoning.
Patient has gastrointestinal distress and is experiencing other symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea, which could be a sign of a viral infection.
Patient has gastrointestinal distress and has had contact with someone who is sick, which could be a sign of a bacterial infection.
